qas.question: How many airports are affiliated with London and incorporate the word London in their names?
The majority of air traffic utilizes how many of the airports in and around London?
In terms of international travel, which airport is the world's busiest?
A fifth terminal was opened in 2008 for which UK airline?
In May 2010, who scrapped British Airways's plans to add a sixth terminal and another runway?

context: London is a major international air transport hub with the busiest city airspace in the world. <a0_0>Eight<a0_0/> airports use the word London in their name, but most traffic passes through <a1_0>six<a1_0/> of these. <a2_0>London Heathrow<a2_0/> Airport, in Hillingdon, West London, is the busiest airport in the world for international traffic, and is the major hub of the nation's flag carrier, <a3_0>British Airways<a3_0/>. In March 2008 its fifth terminal was opened. There were plans for a third runway and a sixth terminal; however, these were cancelled by <a4_0>the Coalition Government<a4_0/> on 12 May 2010.
